\phpListRESTApiClient

example PHP client class to access the phpList Rest API.

To use this class, you need the restapi plugin for phpList, https://resources.phplist.com/plugin/restapi Set the parameters below to match your system:

  • url : URL of your phpList installation
  • loginName : admin login
  • password : matching password
  • remoteProcessingSecret : (optional) the secret as defined in your phpList settings

v 1 * Michiel Dethmers, phpList Ltd, November 18, 2015 Initial implementation of basic API calls

subscribe()

subscribe(string  $emailAddress, string  $lists) : integer

Add a subscriber.

This is the main method to use to add a subscriber. It will add the subscriber as a non-confirmed subscriber in phpList and it will send the Request-for-confirmation email as set up in phpList.

The lists parameter will set the lists the subscriber will be added to. This has to be comma-separated list-IDs, eg "1,2,3,4".

Parameters

string $emailAddress

email address of the subscriber to add
string $lists

comma-separated list of IDs of the lists to add the subscriber to

Returns

integer —

$subscriberId if added, or false if failed

Tags

None found
